artist: Artist: Gaetano Gandolfi; Artist: after Nicolas Poussin
creditline: Gift of funds from Kaywin Feldman and Jim Lutz in honor of John E. Andrus III's 100th birthday
description: after Poussin painting of the same subject; reclining Germanicus on a bed with flowing drapery behind at left; three women--one weeping--and child at left; soldiers with spears at left; printed in black; received matted with L2009.66.2.2
inscription:
Inscription

in bottom margin, in pencil: [136]; LLC, printed in black: [Monsieur du Poussin Peint.]; LRC, printed in black: [G.G.f.]; on back, in graphite and red pencil: various notes and inscriptions
provenance: Collection of Augusto Calabi (born 1890), Milan; by descent to Lorenzo Calabi, Milan; sold to Bergquist; [James Bergquist, Newton, Mass., until 2009; sold to MIA]
title: The Death of Germanicus
